item.title: Tom add a quote by Gary Larson
item.description: "Wait a minute! This is grass! We've been eating grass!" -- Gary Larson

item.title: Tom add a quote by Paul Reubens
item.description: "Is this something you can share with everyone, Amazing Larry?" -- Paul Reubens

item.title: Tom add a quote by Ernest Lehman
item.description: "This matter is best disposed of from a great height, over water." -- Ernest Lehman

item.title: Tom add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Mr. Dick, give me your hand, for your common sense is invaluable." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Tom add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Tom add a quote by Ed Wood
item.description: "You're the ruler of the universe. Try to show a little taste!" -- Ed Wood

item.title: Tom add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I like my smock. You can tell the quality of the artist by the quality of his smock. Actually, I just like to say smock. Smock smock smock smock smock smock." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tom add a quote by Don Dellilo
item.description: "Alfonse invested everything he did with a sense of all-consuming purpose. He knew four languages, had photographic memory, did complex mathematics in his head. He'd once told me that the art of getting ahead in New York was based on learning how to express dissatisfaction in an interesting way. The air was full of rage and complaint. People had no tolerance for your particular hardship unless you knew how to entertain them with it." -- Don Dellilo

item.title: Tom add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Tom add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "If they can get you asking the wrong questions, they don't have to worry about answers." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Tom add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "War was always here. Before man was, war waited for him. The ultimate trade awaiting its ultimate practitioner." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Tom add a quote by Cormac McCarthy
item.description: "Men of God and men of war have strange affinities." -- Cormac McCarthy

item.title: Tom add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Tom add a quote by Joyce Carey
item.description: "I want the best of everything for everybody, and it will cost millions." -- Joyce Carey

item.title: Tom add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. A psychotic is a guy who's just found out what's going on." -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Tom add a quote by Richard Hughes
item.description: "Do your bit to save humanity from lapsing back into barbarity by reading all the novels you can." -- Richard Hughes
